meanings.definition: Hesitate or be reluctant to do something because of moral or ethical considerations.
meanings.sent1: She was scrupling about cheating on the test, knowing it was wrong.
meanings.sent2: He always scruples before making a decision, wanting to do what is right.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scrupling whether to knock over the vase, pondering the consequences.
meanings.sent4: The sun, scrupling to rise too early, waited for the moon to set first.
meanings.sent5: The child's scrupling about stealing the cookie jar showed his strong sense of morality.

meanings.definition: Have doubts or reservations about something.
meanings.sent1: I am scrupling about attending the party, unsure if I will enjoy it.
meanings.sent2: She scruples about the plan, worried it might not work out as expected.
meanings.sent3: The dog was scrupling whether to trust the mailman, unsure of his intentions.
meanings.sent4: The flower, scrupling to bloom in the shade, waited for the sun to shine on it.
meanings.sent5: His scrupling about the new job offer made him hesitant to accept it without further consideration.
